title: DOOMED / CENTRAL FURNACE
description: This is an industrial oven on the first floor of Doomed. You can interact with it and contact Dicemaker.

dialogueTree.title: Central Furnace: "A thick layer of coal dust covers t..."
dialogueTree.english: A thick layer of coal dust covers the furnace, colouring it pitch-black.
dialogueTree.polish: Piec zabarwiony jest na czarno pokrywającą go grubą warstwą pyłu węglowego.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Печ фарбаваны ў чорны колер пакрываюць таўстым слоем вугальнага пылу.

links.title: You: ""Kim, what is this thing? Is it a f..."
links.english: "Kim, what is this thing? Is it a furnace?!"
links.polish: „Kim, co to jest? Jakiś piec?!”
links.belarusian: "Кім, што гэта? Якое-небудзь пячное?!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like it. Looks like an old c..."
links.english: "Looks like it. Looks like an old central furnace used to heat the building. It's connected to the chimney..." He opens the door and gingerly peeks inside.
links.polish: „Na to wygląda. Zdaje się, że to stary piec centralny, który ogrzewał dawniej budynek. Jest podłączony do komina...” – otwiera drzwiczki i ostrożnie zagląda do środka.
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, так. Здаецца, што гэта стары цэнтральны кацёл, які раней ацяпляў будынак. Ён падключаны да коміна..." – адкрывае дзверцы і асцярожна зазірае ўнутр.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No one has used it in ages... No s..."
links.english: "No one has used it in ages... No signs of any recent fire, only dead rats."
links.polish: „Od wieków nikt go nie używał... Żadnych śladów rozpalanego niedawno ognia. Tylko zdechłe szczury”.
links.belarusian: "Стагоддзямі ніхто яго не выкарыстоўваў... Ніякіх слядоў нядаўна распаленага агню. Толькі здохлыя пацукi".

links.title: You: "Look inside the furnace."
links.english: Look inside the furnace.
links.polish: Zajrzyj do pieca.
links.belarusian: Зірні ў печ.

links.title: Central Furnace: "It's dark and grimy here. In the da..."
links.english: It's dark and grimy here. In the darkness, you can hear *chatter*. It's coming from above. A voice -- or several voices -- talking to each other, near the smoke chamber upstairs.
links.polish: Jest tu mrocznie i brudno. W mroku słyszysz *rozmowę*. Dobiega z góry. Głos – lub kilka głosów. Rozmawiają ze sobą gdzieś przy kominie piętro wyżej.
links.belarusian: Тут цёмна і брудна. У цемры чуеш *размову*. Даносіцца зверху. Голас – або некалькі галасоў. Размаўляюць паміж сабой недзе каля коміна на паверсе вышэй.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "The echo is so prominent, it's impo..."
links.english: The echo is so prominent, it's impossible to discern what the voices are saying. Or what's producing them.
links.polish: Echo jest tak silne, że nie sposób stwierdzić, co mówią głosy. Ani skąd pochodzą.
links.belarusian: Эха настолькі моцнае, што немагчыма вызначыць, што кажуць галасы. І адкуль яны паходзяць.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What are you doing?" the lieutenan..."
links.english: "What are you doing?" the lieutenant asks when he sees you climb half-way inside the furnace.
links.polish: „Co ty robisz?” – pyta porucznik, obserwując, jak wchodzisz do wnętrza pieca.
links.belarusian: "Што ты робіш?" — пытаецца лейтэнант, назіраючы, як ты заходзіш унутр печы.

links.title: You: ""I'm hallucinating.""
links.english: "I'm hallucinating."
links.polish: „Doznaję halucynacji”.
links.belarusian: "Я адчуваю галюцынацыі".

Alternate1.english: "I'm hallucinating. Or maybe it's the Entity..."
Alternate1.polish: „Doznaję halucynacji. A może to ta istota...”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Адчуваю галюцынацыі. А можа гэта тая істота..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wait, really?" The lieutenant soun..."
links.english: "Wait, really?" The lieutenant sounds concerned. "Take your head out of the chimney, please. It's not safe."
links.polish: „Chwila, poważnie?” – porucznik sprawia wrażenie zaniepokojonego. „Wyjmij głowę z komina, proszę. To nie jest bezpieczne”.
links.belarusian: "Хвіліначку, сур’ёзна?" – лейтэнант выглядае занепакоеным. "Дастань галаву з коміна, калі ласка. Гэта небяспечна".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It feels safe to know that the lieu..."
links.english: It feels safe to know that the lieutenant's got your back, now and always.
links.polish: Czujesz się bezpiecznie, wiedząc, że możesz liczyć na porucznika, teraz i zawsze.
links.belarusian: Ты адчуваеш сябе ў бяспецы, ведаючы, што можаш разлічваць на лейтэнанта, зараз і заўсёды.

links.title: Volition: "This sounded real, not imagined."
links.english: This sounded real, not imagined.
links.polish: To wydawało się prawdziwe, nie wyobrażone.
links.belarusian: Гэта здавалася сапраўдным, а не ўяўным.

links.title: You: ""I hear the murderer of the hanged..."
links.english: "I hear the murderer of the hanged man talking."
links.polish: „Słyszę, jak morderca powieszonego coś gada”.
links.belarusian: "Чую, як забойца павешанага нешта кажа".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wait, really?" He looks up at the..."
links.english: "Wait, really?" He looks up at the ceiling. "Maybe it's coming from behind those safety curtains we saw upstairs?"
links.polish: „Chwila, poważnie?” – porucznik spogląda na sufit. „Może głos dochodzi zza tych zasłon bezpieczeństwa, które widzieliśmy na piętrze?”
links.belarusian: "Хвіліна, сур'ёзна?" — лейтэнант глядзіць на столь. "Можа, голас ідзе з-за тых ахоўных заслонаў, якія мы бачылі на паверсе?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should ask the lady in the book..."
links.english: "We should ask the lady in the bookstore what's going on with these curtains."
links.polish: „Powinniśmy zapytać kobietę z księgarni o to, co chodzi z tymi zasłonami”.
links.belarusian: "Мы павінны спытаць жанчыну з кніжнай крамы, што адбываецца з гэтымі шторамі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wait, really?" He looks up at the..."
links.english: "Wait, really?" He looks up at the ceiling. "We should investigate, see if someone's upstairs."
links.polish: „Chwila, poważnie?” – porucznik spogląda na sufit. „Może powinniśmy sprawdzić, czy ktoś jest na piętrze”.
links.belarusian: "Хвіліначку, сур'ёзна?" — лейтэнант глядзіць на столь. "Можа, варта праверыць, ці ёсць хто на паверсе".

links.title: You: ""I'm not sure, Kim... but I think I..."
links.english: "I'm not sure, Kim... but I think I can hear someone talking upstairs."
links.polish: „Nie wiem za bardzo, Kim... ale chyba słyszę, jak na górze ktoś coś mówi”.
links.belarusian: "Не вельмі ведаю, кім... але, здаецца, чую, як наверсе нехта нешта гаворыць".

links.title: You: "What's happening?!"
links.english: What's happening?!
links.polish: Co się dzieje?!
links.belarusian: Што адбываецца?!

links.title: Central Furnace: "Maybe it's coming from behind those..."
links.english: Maybe it's coming from behind those safety curtains you saw upstairs? You should investigate...
links.polish: Może głos dochodzi zza tych rolet antywłamaniowych, które widziałeś na górze? Lepiej to sprawdź...
links.belarusian: Можа голас ідзе з-за гэтых антыўзломных ролетаў, якія ты бачыў наверсе? Лепш правер гэта...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Or maybe you're just hungover again..."
links.english: Or maybe you're just hungover again.
links.polish: A może po prostu znów masz kaca.
links.belarusian: А можа ты проста зноў з пахмелля.

links.title: Endurance: "Could it be psychological? Because..."
links.english: Could it be psychological? Because your physical health is fine.
links.polish: Czy to może być jakaś kwestia psychologiczna? Bo fizycznie wszystko z tobą w porządku.
links.belarusian: Ці можа гэта быць нейкай псіхалагічнай праблемай? Бо фізічна з табой усё ў парадку.

links.title: Volition: "This sounded real, not imagined."
links.english: This sounded real, not imagined.
links.polish: To wydawało się prawdziwe, nie wyobrażone.
links.belarusian: Гэта здавалася сапраўдным, а не ўяўным.

links.title: Central Furnace: "Maybe it's coming from somewhere up..."
links.english: Maybe it's coming from somewhere upstairs? You should investigate...
links.polish: Może głos dochodzi gdzieś z góry? Lepiej to sprawdź...
links.belarusian: Можа, голас даносіцца аднекуль зверху? Лепш правер гэта...

links.title: You: "I'm hallucinating..."
links.english: I'm hallucinating...
links.polish: Mam halucynacje...
links.belarusian: У мяне галюцынацыі...

links.title: You: "I hear the murderer of the hanged m..."
links.english: I hear the murderer of the hanged man talking.
links.polish: Słyszę, jak morderca powieszonego coś gada.
links.belarusian: Я чую, як забойца павешанага нешта кажа.

links.title: You: "I'm getting carbon monoxide poisoni..."
links.english: I'm getting carbon monoxide poisoning.
links.polish: Doznaję zatrucia tlenkiem węgla.
links.belarusian: Я атручваюся чадным газам.

links.title: You: "Smear your hands with coal."
links.english: Smear your hands with coal.
links.polish: Ubrudź sobie dłonie węglem.
links.belarusian: Запэцкай рукі вугалем.

links.title: Central Furnace: "A lush layer of coal now covers you..."
links.english: A lush layer of coal now covers your skin, sinking into the wrinkles. Your hands look ancient.
links.polish: Twoja skóra pokryta jest teraz grubą warstwą węgla. Wżera się on w jej zmarszczki. Twoje dłonie wydają się niezwykle stare.
links.belarusian: Твая скура цяпер пакрыта тоўстым слоем вугалю. Ён угрызаецца ў яе зморшчыны. Твае рукі здаюцца надзвычай старамоднымі.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You feel the spirit of Ramout Karza..."
links.english: You feel the spirit of Ramout Karzai, ancient hero of Graad, pulsing through you. All that's left is to cover your face in war-paint.
links.polish: Czujesz pulsującego w tobie ducha Ramouta Karzaia, pradawnego bohatera Graadu. Pozostało ci tylko pomalować twarz w barwy wojenne.
links.belarusian: Вы адчуваеце ў сабе пульсуючы дух Рамаута Карзая, старажытнага героя Грааду. Вам засталося толькі памаляваць твар у ваенныя фарбы.

links.title: You: "Hadramut Karzai! Smear your cheeks..."
links.english: Hadramut Karzai! Smear your cheeks black with coal.
links.polish: Hadramut Karzai! Posmaruj sobie policzki węglem.
links.belarusian: Хадрамут Карзай! Намаж сябе шчокі вугалем.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Three dangerous stripes appear onto..."
links.english: Three dangerous stripes appear onto your cheeks, telling stories of your wild soul.
links.polish: Na twoich policzkach pojawiają się trzy złowrogie pasy. Zdradzają one dzikość twojej duszy.
links.belarusian: На тварах з'яўляюцца тры злавесныя паласы. Яны выдаюць дзікасць тваёй душы.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What... what are you doing?""
links.english: "What... what are you doing?"
links.polish: „Co... Co ty robisz?”
links.belarusian: "Што... Што ты робіш?"

links.title: You: ""I am the reincarnation of an ancie..."
links.english: "I am the reincarnation of an ancient Iilmaraan warrior."
links.polish: „Jestem ponownym wcieleniem pradawnego iilmaraańskiego wojownika”.
links.belarusian: "Я з'яўляюся перараджэннем старадаўняга ільмаранскага воіна".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Please wipe your face clean, offic..."
links.english: "Please wipe your face clean, officer."
links.polish: „Wytrzyj swoją twarz, oficerze”.
links.belarusian: "Вытры цвары, афіцэр".

links.title: Conceptualization: "No, you're a proud warrior, keep it..."
links.english: No, you're a proud warrior, keep it.
links.polish: Nie, jesteś dumnym wojownikiem. I niech tak zostanie.
links.belarusian: Не, вы ганарлівы воін. І няхай так застанецца.

links.title: You: "Don't wipe it."
links.english: Don't wipe it.
links.polish: Nie wycieraj.
links.belarusian: Не выцірай.

links.title: Authority: "These three stripes give you streng..."
links.english: These three stripes give you strength in this dangerous realm. It would be foolish to remove them.
links.polish: Trzy pasy dają ci siłę w tej niebezpiecznej krainie. Głupotą byłoby się ich pozbywać.
links.belarusian: Тры паласы даюць табе сілу ў гэтай небяспечнай краіне. Дуроства было б іх пазбаўляцца.

links.title: You: ""We're exploring this dark place an..."
links.english: "We're exploring this dark place and I need the protection my war-paint affords."
links.polish: „Badamy mroczne miejsce. Potrzebuję ochrony, jaką daje mi malowanie wojenne”.
links.belarusian: "Мы даследуем змрочнае месца. Мне патрэбна абарона, якую дае ваенны размалёўка".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And *this* protects you?""
links.english: "And *this* protects you?"
links.polish: „I *to* zapewnia ci ochronę?”
links.belarusian: "І *гэта* забяспечвае табе абарону?"

links.title: You: ""*This* is traditional war-paint. I..."
links.english: "*This* is traditional war-paint. It will grant me safe passage with the spirits that guard this place."
links.polish: „*To* tradycyjne malowanie wojenne. Pozwala mi bezpiecznie kroczyć wśród strzegących tego miejsca duchów”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта традыцыйная ваенная размалёўка. Яна дазваляе мне бяспечна ісці сярод духаў, якія ахоўваюць гэтае месца".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, sure. Go ahead." He stubborn..."
links.english: "Okay, sure. Go ahead." He stubbornly looks away from you and the furnace.
links.polish: „W porządku, jasne. Jak uważasz” – z uporem odwraca wzrok od ciebie i pieca.
links.belarusian: "У парадку, зразумела. Як лічыш" – упарта адвяртае погляд ад цябе і печы.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Just pointing out -- this is *not*..."
links.english: Just pointing out -- this is *not* traditional Semenese war-paint. No idea where you got it.
links.polish: Zaznaczę tylko – to *nie jest* tradycyjne semeńskie malowanie wojenne. Nie mam pojęcia, skąd to wziąłeś.
links.belarusian: Адзначу толькі – гэта *не з'яўляецца* традыцыйным семеньскім баявым маляваннем. Не маю ўяўлення, адкуль ты гэта ўзяў.

links.title: You: ""It gives me confidence and that's..."
links.english: "It gives me confidence and that's all that matters, Kim."
links.polish: „Daje mi pewność siebie, a to jest najważniejsze, Kim”.
links.belarusian: "Дае мне ўпэўненасць, а гэта самае галоўнае, Кім".

links.title: Authority: "You can feel your cheeks turn red u..."
links.english: You can feel your cheeks turn red under the lieutenant's gaze -- you look like a kid, not a police officer. Even the war-paint can't conceal the embarrassment.
links.polish: Czujesz, jak spojrzenie porucznika przyprawia cię o rumieńce. Wyglądasz jak dzieciak, a nie funkcjonariusz policji. Nawet wojenne malunki nie przykryją twojego wstydu.
links.belarusian: Ты адчуваеш, як позірк лейтэнанта выклікае ў цябе румянец. Ты выглядаеш як дзіця, а не як афіцэр паліцыі. Нават ваенная размалёўка не схуе тваёй сораму.

links.title: You: "Wipe it clean."
links.english: Wipe it clean.
links.polish: Wytrzyj twarz do czysta.
links.belarusian: Вытры твар да чыстаты.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you," the lieutenant nods. "..."
links.english: "Thank you," the lieutenant nods. "So, where were we?" He turns back to the furnace.
links.polish: „Dziękuję” – stwierdza porucznik, kiwając głową. „Na czym skończyliśmy?” – pyta, odwracając się z powrotem w kierunku pieca.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй", — зазначае лейтэнант, ківаючы галавой. "На чым мы спыніліся?" — пытаецца, зноў павярнуўшыся ў бок печы.

links.title: You: ""Nothing!" (Wipe your face clean.)..."
links.english: "Nothing!" (Wipe your face clean.) "Sorry, that was stupid."
links.polish: „Nic takiego!” (Wytrzyj sobie twarz). „Przepraszam, to było głupie”.
links.belarusian: "Нічога такога!" (Вытры твар). "Прабач, гэта было глупа".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. Yes, it was," the lieutenant..."
links.english: "Yes. Yes, it was," the lieutenant nods, before turning back to the furnace.
links.polish: „Tak. Było” – kiwa głową porucznik, po czym odwraca się z powrotem w kierunku pieca.
links.belarusian: "Так. Было", — ківае галавой лейтэнант, пасля чаго зноў паварочваецца ў бок печы.

links.title: Authority: "What a proud warrior! This is how t..."
links.english: What a proud warrior! This is how the hunted becomes the hunter in this dark dangerous place.
links.polish: Cóż za dumny wojownik! Tak właśnie zwierzyna staje się w tym niebezpiecznym, mrocznym miejscu myśliwym.
links.belarusian: Вось які ганарлівы воін! Так менавіта здабыча становіцца ў гэтым небяспечным, цёмным месцы паляўнічым.

links.title: You: "No, let's not express ourselves. Le..."
links.english: No, let's not express ourselves. Let's just wipe our hands clean on our pants.
links.polish: Nie, nie wyrażajmy sami siebie. Po prostu wytrzyjmy dłonie w spodnie.
links.belarusian: Не, не выказвайце самі сябе. Проста выцерце рукі аб штаны.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, how grown-up. The furnace agre..."
links.english: Yes, how grown-up. The furnace agrees.
links.polish: Tak, jakże dorośle. Piec też się ze mną zgadza.
links.belarusian: Так, як жа даросла. Печ таксама са мной згодная.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant seems relieved as we..."
links.english: The lieutenant seems relieved as well.
links.polish: Porucznik też zdaje się odczuwać ulgę.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант таксама, здаецца, адчувае палёгку.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Maybe you could *paint* something w..."
links.english: Maybe you could *paint* something with this coal? Leave a cave painting for future archaeologists... no, that would be stupid.
links.polish: Może mógłbyś coś *narysować* tym węglem? Zostawić malowidło naskalne dla archeologów przyszłości... Nie, to byłoby głupie.
links.belarusian: Можа б ты нешта *намаляваў* гэтым вуглём? Пакінуць наскальны роспіс для археолагаў будучыні... Не, гэта было б глупства.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Still, it's good you have this dirt..."
links.english: Still, it's good you have this dirt on you. Real men wear *coal* for make-up.
links.polish: Tak czy inaczej, dobrze jest mieć na sobie ten brud. Prawdziwi mężczyźni noszą makijaż z *węgla*.
links.belarusian: Так ці інакш, добра мець на сабе гэты бруд. Сапраўдныя мужчыны носяць макіяж з *вуглю*.

links.title: You: ""Those voices I heard... Maybe it's..."
links.english: "Those voices I heard... Maybe it's the malignant Entity? Plaisance said it lives in a chimney."
links.polish: „Te głosy, które słyszałem... Może to ta złowroga istota? Plaisance mówiła, że mieszka w kominie”.
links.belarusian: "Ты галасы, якія я чуў... Можа, гэта тая злавесная істота? Плезанс казала, што яна жыве ў коміне".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right, the rooms do look li..."
links.english: "You're right, the rooms do look like they're connected. But *malignant Entities* don't exist -- at least not the *supra-natural* kind."
links.polish: „Masz rację, pomieszczenia wyglądają na połączone. Ale *złowrogie byty* nie istnieją – przynajmniej jeśli chodzi o te *nadprzyrodzone*”.
links.belarusian: "Ты маеш рацыю, памяшканні выглядаюць злучанымі. Але *злавесныя істоты* не існуюць — па меншай меры, калі гаворка ідзе пра гэтыя *звышнатуральныя*".

links.title: Rhetoric: "Always has to be the sceptic, this..."
links.english: Always has to be the sceptic, this man...
links.polish: Że też on zawsze musi być sceptykiem...
links.belarusian: Што ён заўсёды павінен быць скептыкам...

links.title: Half Light: "Then what was the chatter you heard..."
links.english: Then what was the chatter you heard?
links.polish: W takim razie czym była ta rozmowa, którą słyszałeś?
links.belarusian: Тады што гэта была за размова, якую ты чуў?

links.title: You: "Yell "Hello!" into the furnace."
links.english: Yell "Hello!" into the furnace.
links.polish: Krzyknij do pieca „Halo!”
links.belarusian: Пакліч да печы "Гало!"

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Something *breaks loose* in you. A..."
links.english: Something *breaks loose* in you. A mighty bellow echoes throughout the chimney's depths. The chatter of tiny voices above suddenly cease. Then...
links.polish: Coś się w tobie *uwalnia*. W głębi komina odbija się echem twój potężny ryk. Świergotanie cichych głosików nad tobą milknie. A potem...
links.belarusian: Нешта ў табе *вызваляецца*. У глыбіні коміна разносіцца рэхам твой магутны рык. Цвіканне ціхіх галаскоў над табой сціхае. А потым...

links.title: Central Furnace: ""Hello?" you hear a woman's voice a..."
links.english: "Hello?" you hear a woman's voice answer.
links.polish: „Halo?” – słyszysz odpowiedź kobiecego głosu.
links.belarusian: "Прывітанне?" — чуеш адказ жаночага голасу.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You've awakened the entity!"
links.english: You've awakened the entity!
links.polish: Przebudziłeś istotę!
links.belarusian: Ты разбудзіў істоту!

links.title: Half Light: "And it's a woman! Of course! The ma..."
links.english: And it's a woman! Of course! The malicious entities are *always* women.
links.polish: Kobieta! No tak! Wszystkie te podłe istoty *zawsze* okazują się kobietami.
links.belarusian: Жанчына! Ну так! Усе гэтыя нікчэмныя істоты *заўсёды* аказваюцца жанчынамі.

links.title: You: ""This is the police! Who's there?""
links.english: "This is the police! Who's there?"
links.polish: „Tu policja! Kto tam jest?”
links.belarusian: "Тут міліцыя! Хто там?"

Alternate1.english: "This is the Remote Viewers Division! Identify yourself!"
Alternate1.polish: „Tu Wydział Zdalnych Obserwatorów! Proszę się zidentyfikować!”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Тут Аддзел дыстанцыйных назіральнікаў! Калі ласка, выявіце сябе!"

links.title: Central Furnace: ""Hello! Did you say anything?" Ther..."
links.english: "Hello! Did you say anything?" There's a pause. "I can't hear you, please come upstairs! There's a safety curtain on the second floor, I'll open it!"
links.polish: „Halo? Mówił pan coś?” – pyta głos, po czym przerywa. „Nic nie słyszę, proszę wejść na górę. Na piętrze są rolety antywłamaniowe, otworzę je!”
links.belarusian: "Гало? Пан нешта казаў?" – пытае голас, пасля чаго абрываецца. "Нічога не чую, калі ласка, падніміцеся наверх. На паверсе ёсць ахоўныя ралеты, я іх адкрыю!"

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear a low rumble upstairs -- t..."
links.english: You hear a low rumble upstairs -- the sound of a curtain being pulled aside.
links.polish: Z góry dobiega cię niski hurgot. To odgłos otwieranej rolety.
links.belarusian: Зверху да цябе даносіцца нізкі гуркот. Гэта гука адкрытай ралеты.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods, then points up..."
links.english: The lieutenant nods, then points upstairs. "After you, officer."
links.polish: Porucznik kiwa głową i wskazuje piętro. „Prowadź, oficerze”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант ківае галавой і паказвае на паверх. "Вядзі, афіцэр".

links.title: You: ""I summon the ghost of this Doomed..."
links.english: "I summon the ghost of this Doomed Commercial Area. Answer me, spirit!"
links.polish: „Przyzywam ducha Zgubionej Strefy Handlowej. Odpowiedz mi, zjawo!”
links.belarusian: "Заклікаю дух Загубленай Гандлёвай Зоны. Адкажы мне, зданнешча!"

links.title: You: ""I summon the ghost of this Doomed..."
links.english: "I summon the ghost of this Doomed Commercial Area. Now begone, vile succubus!"
links.polish: „Przyzywam ducha Zgubionej Strefy Handlowej. Precz, podły sukubie!”
links.belarusian: "Заклікаю дух Загубленай Гандлёвай Зоны. Прэч, падлы дзіўны!"

links.title: You: ""Hello! Are you there? Speak to me!""
links.english: "Hello! Are you there? Speak to me!"
links.polish: „Halo? Jest tam kto? Proszę mówić!”
links.belarusian: "Прывітанне? Хто-небудзь ёсць? Калі ласка, гаварыце!"

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Another pathetic yelp sounds off in..."
links.english: Another pathetic yelp sounds off into the vast darkness of the chimney. You're a little embarrassed you produced it.
links.polish: Kolejne żałosne jęknięcie ginie w nieprzeniknionym mroku komina. Trochę ci wstyd, że je z siebie wydałeś.
links.belarusian: Яшчэ адзін жаласны енк знікае ў непранікальнай цемры коміна. Табе трохі сорамна, што ты яго вымавіў.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You muster all your strength and ye..."
links.english: You muster all your strength and yell...
links.polish: Zbierasz wszystkie siły i krzyczysz...
links.belarusian: Збіраеш усе сілы і крычыш...

links.title: You: ""He... he... hekkhhhh...""
links.english: "He... he... hekkhhhh..."
links.polish: „He... He... Heeeek...”
links.belarusian: "Гы... Гы... Гыык..."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Your dehydrated, hungover throat ca..."
links.english: Your dehydrated, hungover throat can produce little more than a dry croak.
links.polish: Twoje wysuszone, skacowane gardło jest w stanie wydobyć z siebie tylko suchy skrzek.
links.belarusian: Тваё сухое, знясіленае горла здольна выдаць толькі сухі скрыгот.

Alternate1.english: Your throat can produce little more than a dry croak. Awkward, since you already had a drink...
Alternate1.polish: Twoje gardło jest w stanie wydobyć z siebie tylko suchy skrzek. Dziwaczne to, bo przecież się napiłeś...
Alternate1.belarusian: Тваё горла можа выдаваць з сябе толькі сухі скрып. Дзівосна гэта, бо ж ты напіўся...

links.title: Volition: "A lifetime of smoking and drinking..."
links.english: A lifetime of smoking and drinking will do that to you.
links.polish: Tak się kończą długie lata nieprzerwanego palenia i picia.
links.belarusian: Вось як заканчваюцца доўгія гады бесперапыннага курэння і пітва.

links.title: Central Furnace: "The chatter from the chimney contin..."
links.english: The chatter from the chimney continue on as before. You seem to have made no impression on whatever's *up there*.
links.polish: Rozmowy w kominie trwają w najlepsze. Cokolwiek *tam* jest, nie zrobiłeś na tym żadnego wrażenia.
links.belarusian: Розмовы ў коміне працягваюцца найлепшым чынам. Што б там ні было, ты не зрабіў на гэтым ніякага ўражання.

links.title: Central Furnace: "Then again -- maybe it's worth actu..."
links.english: Then again -- maybe it's worth actually trying something *up there*?
links.polish: Ale może warto się *tam* wybrać i spróbować coś zrobić?
links.belarusian: Але можа варта туды паехаць і паспрабаваць нешта зрабіць?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm, maybe you should let your voi..."
links.english: "Hmm, maybe you should let your voice rest, officer. Try again later."
links.polish: „Hmm... Może powinieneś dać swojemu głosowi odpocząć, oficerze. Spróbuj jeszcze raz później”.
links.belarusian: "Гм... Магчыма, табе варта даць свайму голасу адпачыць, афіцэру. Паспрабуй зноў пазней".

links.title: You: "Kick it with your foot."
links.english: Kick it with your foot.
links.polish: Kopnij go.
links.belarusian: Піхні яго.

links.title: Central Furnace: "A hollow ring echoes through the fu..."
links.english: A hollow ring echoes through the furnace. Your toe hurts.
links.polish: Piec rozbrzmiewa głuchym brzęknięciem. Boli cię duży palec u nogi.
links.belarusian: Печ разносіцца глухім звонам. Баліць вялікі палец на назе.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Адыдзі].

dialogueTree.title: Central Furnace: "A thick layer of coal dust covers t..."
dialogueTree.english: A thick layer of coal dust covers the furnace, colouring it pitch-black.
dialogueTree.polish: Piec zabarwiony jest na czarno pokrywającą go grubą warstwą pyłu węglowego.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Печ афарбавана ў чорны колер з-за тоўстага пласта вугальнага пылу, які пакрывае яе.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Looks like this furnace has a face..."
links.english: Looks like this furnace has a face and it's a face of agony.
links.polish: Wygląda to, jakby piec miał twarz. Wykrzywioną w koszmarnym cierpieniu.
links.belarusian: Выглядае так, быццам печ мае твар. Скурчаная ў жудасным пакуце.
